original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽11.11. Vedanāttika, Vipākattika🔽Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ navipākaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto navipāko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya  vedanā ttika vipāka ttika  na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na vipākam dhammam paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Dhamma-reversal, the Tikatika-commentary on the Paṭṭhāna text🔽The section on feeling, the section on result🔽A resultant phenomenon associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is a condition for a resultant phenomenon associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, as a condition by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekūnapaññāsa …pe… purejāte āsevane aṭṭhacattālīsa …pe… avigate ekūnapaññāsa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā ekūnapaññāsa pe purejāte āsevane aṭṭhacattālīsa pe avigate ekūnapaññāsa saṅkhitta
